Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw and label different plants and animals coexisting within the aquatic environment.
The student can identify and label resources necessary for survival, like water and light, accurately.
The student can illustrate and explain with labels how fish interact with their surroundings, such as swimming in water or hiding among plants.
The student can demonstrate with labeled diagrams how plants absorb sunlight and water to grow, showcasing their understanding of the environment.
The student can illustrate how fish rely on water as part of their ecosystem, explaining how various parts of the environment interact.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit labels on minor elements or use inconsistent terminology (e.g., labeling 'rocks' as 'stones').
The student might overlook minute details within the ecosystem that aren't central to the main focus of the drawing (e.g., the exact species of plants shown might not be labeled).
